args: Your revenge. Why don't you give up on it?
I'm just thinking about how you've changed\nsince meeting the Auspex.

Before, all you could think of was revenge.
But now you're talking about the future and
possibilities, and even getting involved
with other people.
So don't you think this new you might be\nable to find contentment in something\nother than revenge?
Assisting you in your quest for vengeance\nwas to be my penance.
But if you can be happy without it,\nI think you should consider that option.
Perhaps it might even be better for you\nin the end.
Without you, the plan to revive Satan\nwill grind to a halt.
And yes, Origa would likely try to kill you,\nwhich means you'd have to abandon the\napostles, but you would still have me.
We'd stay bound by our Sigil and could\nstart a new life somewhere far away from\nall this. What do you think?

If you did that, you wouldn't be betraying
your comrades and Origa wouldn't be in
danger. None of the things you fear would
have to come to pass.
It doesn't sound so bad, does it?
It's not yet too late to back out.
Just think about it. Take a moment and\nthink hard about what you hold most dear.
(Since meeting Origa, I've learned you can\nlive in the present and believe in the\nfuture, no matter what your past may be.)
(She's so different from me.\nBut now I have...)
Er, did you not realize I was here?
I tried to be stealthy, but I figured you\nwould suss me out anyway. So, um...\ndoes this mean I'm getting better?
Oh, that's great! But this is only the first\nstep, because I'm going to keep improving\nevery single day!
And one day, I'll become so good that\nwe can go on missions together!
I have every faith in you.

Thanks! ...So, um, on that note, I was
wondering if you could give me some
more pointers today? I wanted to know
how best to move while staying in cover.
You look concerned, Basileus.\nIt is not like you to display your emotions\nso clearly.
You're right. In fact, since I've met you,\nI've been doing a number of things that\nare utterly unlike myself.
I apologize for what I am about to say,\nOriga, but I must be honest with you.
I don't want you to be a vessel for Satan.
Explain yourself! Are you objecting to\nour plan?!
It has nothing to do with the plan.
I don't want to put you in danger.
I know it is not my place to say such\nthings, and that by doing so I put you\nin a terrible position as well.
So I am not asking you to respond to my\nwords or feelings. But I simply cannot\nabide by this plan any longer.
I don't understand. Why would you risk\nsuch a thing for someone like...like me?
Because you changed me. You taught me\nthat I could live in the present even\nwithout the revenge I thought I needed.
You made me realize that I wanted\nto see the future you long for.
No. If this future is one in which you have\nto sacrifice yourself, then I don't want it.
It is a burden I would gladly take on\nmyself, but I know you cannot control\nSatan without an Auspex's mana.

But there remains great risk even with
your power, including the possibility that
he takes over your consciousness and you
are lost to us forever.
And in the worst-case scenario...\nyou could die.
I know that a world without possibility\nis one without hope for all people.
But is it really worth it to sacrifice\nabsolutely everything for a tiny sliver\nof hope?
Why don't you protect the present\ninstead of the future? Why don't—
I TOLD YOU TO STOP! I won't hesitate to\nexecute you!
I don't want to waver. I don't want to lose\nheart. I don't want to be afraid of this.
I'm scared of killing. I'm scared of dying.\nBut more than anything, I'm terrified of\na world without possibility.
If I do nothing and the Progenitor is\nrevived, I'll die all the same.
And it will not just be me. Countless\npeople fated for death will die as well.\nSo I have no choice!
I am not sure what you mean.
I saw it. I saw a world ruled by\nthe Progenitor.
And in that world, I die.\nNo matter what I do. Inevitably.
I die without fulfilling any of my wishes\nor knowing a single moment of happiness.
And not just me. All who are fated\nto die perish in the same way.\nThere is no chance of survival.
That's what a world without possibility\nis like?
The present I hold so dear can only exist\nbecause we live in a world of possibility.
Because of possibility, I was able to live,\nbecome an Auspex, and...meet you.
That's why I want to protect this world even\nif it means becoming a vessel for Satan.
No matter what dangers await me,\nI can't run from them.
But thank you, Basileus.\nAnd...I'm sorry for all of this.
(What can I do to protect the future of the\nperson I most care for...?)
It appears you've found your resolve.
Yes. As planned, I will abandon\nthe apostles and resurrect Satan.
I'll kill Graht with my own hands and\ngaze upon the new world with Origa.
I will protect this world of possibility.
(If that will allow me to protect\nthose I hold most dear...)
I won't hesitate again, even if it means\nI am forever branded a traitor.
